is the standard developer platform for code search and navigation at many of the largest and most exacting technology companies. With Sourcegraph, every company has access to the same kind of tools that Google and Facebook developers use every day.

properties.aria-label: Introducing Bitbucket Server repository permissions permalink

children.value: Configuring Sourcegraph to enforce Bitbucket Server repository permissions for code search and navigation is now available for instances with < 2,500 repositories.
Making this possible, is the new
field, which enables Sourcegraph to communicate with the Bitbucket Server through an application link. Check out the
configuring Bitbucket Server and Sourcegraph guide
for requirements and end to end configuration.
We are working closely with our customers who have larger Sourcegraph instances to improve performance beyond 10,000+ repositories.

properties.aria-label: Improved code reviews with line decorations in pull requests permalink

children.value: Improved code reviews with line decorations in pull requests
View on Vimeo
Line decorations enhance code views with Sourcegraph extensions such as
. In 3.5, line decorations are now available on pull/merge requests on GitHub, Bitbucket Server, and GitLab.

properties.aria-label: Powering code alerts with saved searches permalink

children.value: Powering code alerts with saved searches
View on Vimeo
User-level and organization-level saved searches are now separate. You can view and manage saved searches in the user and organization profile areas, respectively.
can be used to bookmark your frequently used searches. Additionally, you can monitor critical parts of your code by turning on saved search email notifications.

properties.aria-label: New orgs field to optimize repository syncing for GitHub organizations permalink

children.value: field to optimize repository syncing for GitHub organizations
For customers using GitHub with 1,000+ repositories, Sourcegraph sometimes exceeds GitHub‚Äôs search API rate limit during syncing, and may result in an incomplete set of cloned repositories.
has been added for customers who want to sync all repositories for their organization. This uses a different GitHub API that is not subject to rate limiting.
field is a list of GitHub organizations:

properties.aria-label: Repository syncing status for site admins permalink

children.value: Repository syncing status for site admins
View on Vimeo
To give more visibility into the status of repository syncing and updating operations, we added an experimental status indicator in the navigation bar.
To enable the repository syncing status indicator, add this setting to your site configuration:
Due to the experimental status of this feature, Sourcegraph instances with 500+ repositories may experience confusing status updates.
Indexed search now supports matching consecutive literal newlines, with queries like e.g.
allows admins to select all repositories from the specified organizations to be synced.
allows users to exclude stale repositories that don‚Äôt contain commits (to the branch being searched over) past a specified date from their search query.
enables Sourcegraph to enforce the repository permissions defined in Bitbucket Server.

A new, experimental status indicator in the navigation bar allows admins to quickly see whether the configured repositories are up to date or how many are currently being updated in the background. You can enable the status indicator with the following site configuration:

The saved searches UI has changed. There is now a saved searches page in the user and organizations settings area. A saved search appears in the settings area of the user or organization it is associated with.
Fixed repository search patterns which contain
, which in some cases would lead to our repository search excluding some repositories from the results.
Fixed an issue where the Phabricator native integration would be broken on recent Phabricator versions. This fix depends on v1.2 of the
Fixed an issue where the ‚ÄúEmpty repository‚Äù banner would be shown on a repository page when starting to clone a repository.
Prevent data inconsistency on cached archives due to restarts. (#4366)
On the /extensions page, the UI is now less ambiguous when an extension has not been activated. (#4446)
Thank you to the many people who contributed to Sourcegraph since the last release!
